hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry.Line
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Line2, Line3

    public class Line
extends Object
    An infinite line. It is specified by a point P and a direction D through the formula P + t*D where the t parameter is used to specify the points of the line. D is not necessarily unit length.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Field Detail

      • EPS

        protected static final double EPS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getPoint

        public ImmutableVector getPoint()
        Returns the point P specifying the line.
        Returns:
        P

      • getDir

        public ImmutableVector getDir()
        Returns the direction D of the line. The length of the direction vector is not necessarily one.
        Returns:
        D

      • getUnitDir

        public ImmutableVector getUnitDir()
        Returns the unit vector specifying the direction of the line. The returned vector is identical to
        getDir().normalized().
        Returns:
        the direction of the line as a unit vector

      • getPointAt

        public Vector getPointAt(double t)
        Returns the point on this line corresponding to the parameter value. The parameter t is linear, its value is 0 at point and 1 at point+dir.
        Parameters:
        t - the parameter value
        Returns:
        P + t*D

      • getPointWhereCoord

        public Vector getPointWhereCoord(int coord,
                        double value)
        Returns the point of the line for which the specified coordinate has a given value.
        Parameters:
        coord - the index of the coordinate
        value - the value of the coordinate
        Returns:
        the requested point of this line
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the index is invalid
        DegenerateCaseException - when this line is parallel with the <coord> = value plane

      • getClosestT

        public double getClosestT(Vector p)
        Returns the parameter value specifying the point of the line which is closest to the argument. It is given by the expression
        p.minus(getPoint()).dot(getUnitDir())/getDir().norm().
        Parameters:
        p - an arbitrary point
        Returns:
        the parameter value t for which getPointAt(t) is the point of this line closest to p.

      • distance

        public double distance(Vector p)
        Returns the distance between this line and a point.
        Parameters:
        p - a point
        Returns:
        the distance of p from this line
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the point is not in the same space as this line (e.g. one is 2D and the other is 3D)

      • distance

        public double distance(Line line)
        Returns the distance between this line and the argument.
        Parameters:
        line - the other line
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the two lines are not in the same space (e.g. one is 2D and the other is 3D)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
